panchakarma.title: Panchakarma Therapies
panchakarma.description: The five sacred cleansing procedures that form the foundation of Ayurvedic healing.

basti.title: Basti (Enema Therapy)
basti.description: Medicated enema for detoxification and treating Vata disorders, joint pain, and digestive issues.

details.fullDescription: Basti is considered the most important of all Panchakarma treatments and is especially effective for Vata disorders. It involves administration of medicated oils, ghee, or herbal decoctions through the rectum, which helps cleanse the colon and nourish the body tissues.
benefits: Reduces lower back pain and sciatica
details.procedure: The treatment begins with a gentle abdominal massage with warm medicated oil, followed by administration of the medicated enema. The patient rests for a specific duration before elimination.
details.idealFor: People suffering from Vata disorders, chronic constipation, lower back pain, joint problems, and neurological conditions

vamana.title: Vamana (Emesis Therapy)
vamana.description: Therapeutic vomiting to eliminate excess Kapha dosha from the body.

details.fullDescription: Vamana is a controlled therapeutic emesis procedure that eliminates excess Kapha dosha from the body. It is particularly beneficial for respiratory disorders, skin conditions, and metabolic issues caused by Kapha imbalance.
details.procedure: After proper preparation with internal oleation and sweating therapies, the patient is given emetic medicines to induce controlled vomiting, eliminating toxins from the upper body.
details.duration: 2-3 hours for main procedure, with 7-day preparation
details.idealFor: People with respiratory problems, chronic cold, asthma, skin diseases, obesity, and diabetes

virechana.title: Virechana (Purgation)
virechana.description: Controlled purgation to cleanse the digestive system and remove Pitta toxins.

details.fullDescription: Virechana is a controlled purgation therapy that cleanses the Pitta dosha and removes toxins accumulated in the liver and gallbladder. It is highly effective for treating skin disorders, digestive issues, and Pitta-related conditions.
details.procedure: Following internal oleation for 3-7 days, purgative medicines are administered to induce controlled bowel movements, eliminating accumulated toxins from the GI tract.
details.duration: 1 day for main procedure, with 3-7 days preparation
details.idealFor: People with skin diseases, chronic acidity, liver disorders, jaundice, and inflammatory conditions

nasya.title: Nasya (Nasal Therapy)
nasya.description: Administration of medicated oils through the nose for head and neck ailments.

details.fullDescription: Nasya is a therapeutic procedure where medicated oils, powders, or herbal juices are administered through the nasal passage. The nose is considered the gateway to the head, and this therapy effectively treats disorders above the clavicle.
benefits: Treats hair fall and premature greying
Reduces stress and promotes mental clarity
details.procedure: Facial massage and steam therapy precede the nasal administration of medicated oils. The patient lies with head tilted back while drops are instilled in each nostril.
details.idealFor: People with sinusitis, migraines, hair problems, neurological disorders, and ENT conditions

raktamokshana.title: Raktamokshana
raktamokshana.description: Blood purification therapy for skin diseases and blood-related disorders.

details.fullDescription: Raktamokshana is a blood purification therapy that removes vitiated blood from the body. It is highly effective for treating skin diseases, gout, and conditions caused by blood toxicity. Various methods including leech therapy may be used.
details.procedure: After proper assessment, blood letting is done through various methods depending on the condition. Leech therapy (Jalaukavacharana) is the most gentle and commonly used method.
details.duration: 30-60 minutes per session, sessions as needed
details.idealFor: People with chronic skin diseases, eczema, psoriasis, gout, and blood-related disorders
